fields.headline: Trump encourages Senate to ‘go nuclear’
fields.bodyText: Donald Trump said if Democrats filibustered his supreme court nominee, Neil Gorsuch, he would encourage Senate Republicans to “go nuclear”, meaning change Senate rules to push the nomination through. Release the Kraken If we end up with that gridlock, I would say, ‘If you can, Mitch, go nuclear.’ Because that would would be an absolute shame if a man of this quality was put up to that neglect. I would say it’s up to Mitch, but I would say, ‘Go for it.’ – Donald Trump Meet Trump’s nominee Trump national security adviser Michael Flynn said the US was “officially putting Iran on notice” in reaction to an Iranian missile test and an attack on a Saudi warship by Iranian-backed Houthi rebels in Yemen. Flynn did not elaborate. Tough talk It might take just a minute to catch up on the latest politics news. But good journalism takes time and costs money. If you like the Guardian’s politics coverage, please consider joining us by becoming a member for only $6.99 a month. Thanks for reading! Become a Guardian member Trump personally approved a US commando raid in Yemen that left one elite serviceman dead and may have killed an eight-year-old American girl, the US military has told the Guardian. Read the story Two Republican senators, Susan Collins of Maine and Lisa Murkowski of Alaska, said they would not support Trump’s education secretary nominee, Betsy DeVos. One more ‘no’ and DeVos could be toast. Senators say no
